properties.name: levelTypes
properties.description: Gets all 9 level types in the list. Each type can be 'Bullet', 'Number' or 'Picture'.

properties.name: levelExistences
properties.description: Checks whether each of the 9 levels exists in the list. A true value indicates the level exists, which means there is at least one list item at that level.

methods.name: insertParagraph
methods.description: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location. The insertLocation value can be 'Start', 'End', 'Before' or 'After'.

parameters.name: paragraphText
parameters.description: Required. The paragraph text to be inserted.

parameters.name: insertLocation
parameters.description: Required. The value can be 'Start', 'End', 'Before' or 'After'.

methods.name: getLevelParagraphs
methods.description: Gets the paragraphs that occur at a specified level in the list.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

methods.name: setLevelBullet
methods.description: Sets the bullet format at the specified level in the list. If the bullet is 'Custom', the charCode is required.
methods.signature: setLevelBullet(level: number, listBullet: ListBullet, charCode: number, fontName: string)

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

parameters.name: listBullet
parameters.description: Required. The bullet.

parameters.name: charCode
parameters.description: Optional. The bullet character's code value. Used only if the bullet is 'Custom'.

parameters.name: fontName
parameters.description: Optional. The bullet's font name. Used only if the bullet is 'Custom'.

methods.name: setLevelNumbering
methods.description: Sets the numbering format at the specified level in the list.
methods.signature: setLevelNumbering(level: number, listNumbering: ListNumbering, formatString: object[])

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

parameters.name: listNumbering
parameters.description: Required. The ordinal format.

parameters.name: formatString
parameters.description: Optional. The numbering string format defined as an array of strings and/or integers. Each integer is a level of number type that is higher than or equal to this level. For example, an array of ["(", level - 1, ".", level, ")"] can define the format of "(2.c)", where 2 is the parent's item number and c is this level's item number.

methods.name: getLevelString
methods.description: Gets the bullet, number or picture at the specified level as a string.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

methods.name: setLevelPicture
methods.description: Sets the picture at the specified level in the list.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

parameters.name: base64EncodedImage
parameters.description: Optional. The base64 encoded image to be set. If not given, the default picture is set.

methods.name: getLevelPicture
methods.description: Gets the base64 encoded string representation of the picture at the specified level in the list.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

methods.name: getLevelFont
methods.description: Gets the font of the bullet, number or picture at the specified level in the list.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

methods.name: resetLevelFont
methods.description: Resets the font of the bullet, number or picture at the specified level in the list.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

parameters.name: resetFontName
parameters.description: Optional. Indicates whether to reset the font name. The default is false, which indicates the font name is kept unchanged.

methods.name: setLevelAlignment
methods.description: Sets the alignment of the bullet, number or picture at the specified level in the list.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

parameters.name: alignment
parameters.description: Required. The level alignment that can be 'left', 'centered' or 'right'.

methods.name: setLevelIndents
methods.description: Sets the two indents of the specified level in the list.
methods.signature: setLevelIndents(level: number, textIndent: float, textIndent: float)

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

parameters.name: textIndent
parameters.description: Required. The text indent in points. It is the same as paragraph left indent.

parameters.name: textIndent
parameters.description: Required. The relative indent, in points, of the bullet, number or picture. It is the same as paragraph first line indent.

methods.name: setLevelStartingNumber
methods.description: Sets the starting number at the specified level in the list. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Required. The level in the list.

parameters.name: startingNumber
parameters.description: Required. The number to start with.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Fills the proxy object created in JavaScript layer with property and object values specified in the parameter.

parameters.name: param
parameters.description: Accepts parameter and relationship names as delimited string or an array. Or, provide [loadOption](loadoption.md) object.
